author: Lucho Suárez
title: El chavismo busca desestimular la participación ciudadana con detenciones arbitrarias, según expertos en DDHH
text:
Especialistas en asuntos políticos y activistas de derechos humanos (DDHH) explicaron que las detenciones arbitrarias y las persecuciones ordenadas por la administración de Nicolás Maduro en lo que va de 2024, son acciones que buscan desestimular la participación ciudadana.
Corresponsalía lapatilla.com
Al respecto, el politólogo Ángel Lugo destacó la resiliencia de los venezolanos, que aún alzan la voz de protesta para exigir respeto ante la violación sistemáticas de sus derechos.
“Estamos empezando a pelear por las condiciones electorales, la sociedad venezolana quiere votar (…) y la única manera que tiene el régimen es volverse restrictivo, castigar. Entonces, acusa a gente de traición a la patria para meterle miedo, para que no participen”, subrayó Lugo.
Entretanto, el exparlamentario y defensor de DDHH, Rafael Narváez, cuestionó la detención y persecuciones políticas, así como la falta de independencia de los poderes públicos en Venezuela.
“El Estado se equivoca en la persecución hacia un pueblo muerto de hambre, con pensiones miserables (…) y esa persecución tiene que ver con algo: no hay poderes públicos independientes, la justicia penal la están usando como brazo armado de ejecución para violentar el artículo 49, que es el debido proceso, el derecho a la defensa, el derecho a la presunción de inocencia, el derecho a las garantías constitucionales”, enfatizó Narváez.
Tanto Lugo como Narváez ofrecieron estas declaraciones en medio de un foro de democracia y derechos humanos organizado por la Plataforma Unitaria, en San Juan de los Morros, capital del estado Guárico, este jueves 25 de enero.

author: Logan Wright
title: Boeing Faces Strike as Workers Demand Better Wages and Conditions - Investors Hangout
text: Boeing Faces Strike as Workers Demand Better Wages and Conditions [Logan Wright](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79745)Updated: 09-13-2024 01:27 AM Boeing Faces Potential Strike Impacting Aircraft Production Boeing Co. (NYSE: BA) is currently confronting significant challenges as over 30,000 employees have decided to go on strike, posing threats to its aircraft production capabilities. Union Vote and Strike Decision In a decisive action, a staggering 94.6% of Boeing employees in key locations voted against a proposed labor contract. The overwhelming decision to strike surpassed expectations with a striking 96% in favor, indicating the union's dissatisfaction with the preliminary agreement. This outcome underscores the workers’ sentiment and desire for better conditions. What Led to the Strike? According to IAM District 751 President Jon Holden, the strike was termed an "unfair labor practice strike." He highlighted issues such as discriminatory conduct and unlawful practices that influenced the workers’ vote. Despite Boeing's proposal that included a 25% wage increase and improved health-care benefits, union representatives argued that the offer failed to meet their demands amid rising living costs, advocating for raises closer to 40%. Company Response Boeing's leadership has been facing pressure during this critical moment. CEO Kelly Ortberg, who has just stepped into the role, encouraged employees to reconsider their options for the sake of the company's recovery momentum. The financial implications are still being analyzed as the length of the strike will directly affect Boeing's operations. Financial Impact of Strikes According to aerospace analyst Sheila Kahyaoglu from Jefferies, a strike lasting 30 days could potentially drain $1.5 billion from Boeing's financial reserves. This looming risk adds weight to the urgency for resolution between the company and its workers. The Broader Context This strike evolves during a challenging period for Boeing, which is still worked to address past production delays and quality control issues impacting its aircraft. Recently, Boeing reported a modest recovery in deliveries of 40 commercial jets in August, showing progress yet still hampered by previous manufacturing defects that affected their 737 MAX line. Production Delays and Future Goals In addition to these concerns, Boeing communicated to its suppliers a new six-month delay concerning a vital production milestone for the 737 MAX. The company has now set a target to achieve a monthly output of 42 jets by a new deadline. While delays like these have warranted frustration among workers, many have expressed their discontent with the current contract proposals. Market Reaction Boeing's stock closed at $162.77 recently and saw a slight drop in after-hours trading. This downward trend adds a noteworthy backdrop to the unfolding labor situation, with shares down approximately 35.35% year-to-date. Frequently Asked Questions What is the reason for the Boeing workers' potential strike? The strike stems from workers rejecting a proposed labor contract that they felt did not adequately address their demands for higher wages and better benefits. How many Boeing employees are involved in the strike vote? Over 30,000 Boeing employees voted on the strike, with a considerable majority supporting the decision to take industrial action. What has Boeing's management said about the strike? Boeing’s CEO urged employees to accept the proposal, suggesting that a strike could jeopardize the company's recovery efforts. What are the financial implications of the strike? A strike lasting 30 days could cost Boeing approximately $1.5 billion, according to industry analysts. How is this strike affecting Boeing's aircraft production goals? The potential strike complicates an already difficult situation for Boeing, which is facing ongoing production delays and quality control issues amid labor unrest. author: VNExplorer
title: Cascada Escalera, el atractivo natural que se esconde al noroeste de Córdoba
text: Entre los destinos que tiene Córdoba para disfrutar estas vacaciones de invierno, se destaca un increíble salto de agua al noroeste provincial. Si bien los ríos no son los ideales para la época invernal, el paisaje es digno de conocer en cualquier estación. Mirá también: Cómo es el “Miami cordobés”, la playa en el interior de Córdoba con aguas cristalinas Se trata de la Cascada Escalera, en el departamento de Cruz del Eje. Un salto de agua que atrae a propios y ajenos por sus escalones de corte perfectamente recto. La cascada tiene tres caídas, la más alta de 20 metros de altura. Cascada Escalera, Pampa de Olaen. CÓMO ES LA CASCADA ESCALERA Ubicada en la Pampa de Olaen, la Cascada Escalera tiene tres saltos que terminan en una olla de 30 metros de diámetro y 11, de profundidad. El espejo de agua está en medio de una quebrada rocosa erosionada por el río Olaen. Cascada Escalera, Pampa de Olaen. El lugar está rodeado de grandes piedras y verde vegetación, donde los visitantes pueden instalarse a pasar el día. Sin embargo, se debe tener en cuenta que la Cascada Escalera es más admirable en época de lluvias, ya que el caudal es lo que maravilla a los visitantes. Cascada Escalera, Pampa de Olaen. El espacio está concesionado por la Fundación San Roque, y se debe pagar para su ingreso. Allí hay una pequeña proveeduría, asador comunitario, baños y mesas bajo los árboles. CÓMO LLEGAR A LA CASCADA ESCALERA La Cascada Escalera se ubica a 109 kilómetros de distancia de Córdoba capital. En auto, significa un viaje de más de dos horas y media. Cascada Escalera, Pampa de Olaen. Mirá también: Aguas turquesas entre piedras calizas, el oasis escondido en las Sierras de Córdoba Para llegar al salto, hay que dirigirse en dirección a La Falda, pero, antes de llegar y a la altura de Molinari, se debe doblar hacia la izquierda y tomar rumbo a la Pampa de Olaen. Se deben seguir los carteles que indican a Candelaria. Hay que tener en cuenta que, al desviarse de ruta 38, se deben hacer 50 kilómetros de camino de ripio.

author: Admin Pat
title: The comeback win underlines the fight still left in these players.
text:
Arsenal returned to winning ways with a great victory over our bitter rivals in a game of immense significance. Dominic Solanke’s own goal and a brilliant finish from the excellent Leandro Trossard secured our second win over Tottenham this season.
Gooners would undoubtedly have feared the worst when Tottenham somehow managed to take the lead after we had utterly dominated the opening period of the encounter. With Son Heung-min giving them the lead in the 25th minute, it did not take long for us to respond. We completely turned the game on its head in just four minutes.
We levelled in the 40th minute through an own goal, forced by yet another well-executed corner routine. The second goal was even better, as we capitalised on a turnover in midfield and worked the ball to Leandro Trossard. He went on to strike the ball home from the edge of the box, delivering what ultimately became the winning goal.
This victory, and particularly how it was achieved, demonstrates that there is still a fight left in these players during this campaign. Many have written off the season as another failed attempt at glory, but matches like this should prompt them to reconsider. We showed immense character to come from behind and secure the win. Even though it was a huge derby clash, the match was a must-win after seeing our rivals drop points the day before.
I am so glad we managed to come out on top in a game where we had fewer chances than in previous outings. While it was far from a perfect performance, the most important outcome was securing the three points and cutting the gap to Liverpool.
Now trailing Liverpool by just four points, barring their outstanding fixture, we are in a much better position to capitalise on any slip-ups by the Reds as we aim to secure a first League title in over 20 years.
BENJAMIN KENNETH
